meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'teary': having tears in the eyes.
meanings.sent1: She was the teariest in the room after watching the sad movie.
meanings.sent2: Out of all the students, she was the teariest when it came to emotional scenes.
meanings.sent3: The teariest puppy at the shelter melted everyone's hearts with its big, sad eyes.
meanings.sent4: Her teariest moments were always during heartfelt goodbyes.
meanings.sent5: The teariest goodbye she ever experienced was when her best friend moved away.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of 'teary': having the most tears in the eyes.
meanings.sent1: After the touching speech, she became the teariest person in the entire audience.
meanings.sent2: Among all her friends, she was always the teariest at weddings.
meanings.sent3: The teariest contestant on the show made everyone emotional with their heartfelt story.
meanings.sent4: The teariest moment of the play was when the main character bid farewell to their beloved pet.
meanings.sent5: In the teariest scene of the movie, the protagonist finally found closure with their past.
